00023 #include <ccpdb.hpp>
00024 
00025 namespace loos {
00026 
00027   // Do some initial parsing to setup the Trajectory object...
00028 
00029   void CCPDB::init(void) {
00030     char buf[512];
00031 
00032     // Read the first frame to get the # of atoms...
00033     frame.read(*(ifs()));
00034     _natoms = frame.size();
00035     cached_first = true;
00036     indices.push_back(0l);
00037     indices.push_back(ifs()->tellg());
00038 
00039     // Now count the # of END statements...
00040     while (ifs()->getline(buf, sizeof(buf)))
00041       if (strncmp("END", buf, 3) == 0)
00042         indices.push_back(ifs()->tellg());
00043 
00044     _nframes = indices.size() - 1;
00045     ifs()->clear();
00046     ifs()->seekg(indices[1]);
00047   }
00048 
00049 
00050   void CCPDB::seekFrameImpl(const uint i) {
00051     if (i >= _nframes)
00052       throw(std::runtime_error("Error- Attempting to access more frames than are in the trajectory."));
00053 
00054     ifs()->clear();
00055     ifs()->seekg(indices[i]);
00056     if (ifs()->fail())
00057       throw(std::runtime_error("Error- cannot seek to the requested frame in trajectory."));
00058   }
00059 
00060 
00061   bool CCPDB::parseFrame(void) {
00062     if (ifs()->eof())
00063       return(false);
00064 
00065     // We cheat here...  Maybe it would be better to have a PDB::clear()
00066     // or AtomicGroup::clear() member function???
00067     // Note:  For some reason, PDB newframe(*(ifs())) doesn't parse correctly...
00068     PDB newframe;
00069     newframe.read(*(ifs()));
00070     frame = newframe;
00071     if (frame.size() == 0)
00072       return(false);
00073 
00074     return(true);
00075   }
00076 
00077 
00078   std::vector<GCoord> CCPDB::coords(void) {
00079     std::vector<GCoord> result(_natoms);
00080 
00081     for (uint i=0; i<_natoms; i++)
00082       result[i] = frame[i]->coords();
00083 
00084     return(result);
00085   }
00086 
00087   void CCPDB::updateGroupCoords(AtomicGroup& g) {
00088 
00089     if (g.size() == frame.size()) {
00090       g.copyCoordinates(frame);
00091     } else {
00092       for (AtomicGroup::iterator i = g.begin(); i != g.end(); ++i) {
00093         int idx = (*i)->id() - 1;
00094         (*i)->coords(frame[idx]->coords());
00095       }
00096     }
00097   }
